dictionaryDetailResponses.wordMeaning: of or relating to the pictorial arts
{sx|pictorial||}
of, relating to, or involving such reproductive methods as those of engraving, etching, lithography, photography, serigraphy, and woodcut
of or relating to the art of printing {dx}see also {dxt|graphic design|graphic design|}{/dx}
relating or according to graphics {dx_def}see {dxt|graphic:2|graphic:2|3b}{/dx_def}
relating to or consisting of images or video displayed on the screen of a computer or other digital device
formed by writing, drawing, or engraving
vividly or plainly shown or described
using offensive or obscene words including swear words
marked by clear lifelike or vividly realistic description
of, relating to, or represented by a {d_link|graph|graph:1}
of or relating to the written or printed word or the symbols or devices used in writing or printing to represent sound or convey meaning
a product of graphic art
the graphic media
a graphic representation (such as a picture, map, or {d_link|graph|graph:1}) used especially for illustration
a pictorial image created by a computer for display on the screen of a digital device
a message, image, etc. superimposed on a video
{dx}compare {dxt|chyron|chyron|}{/dx}
the process whereby a computer displays graphics
the art or science of drawing a representation of an object on a two-dimensional surface according to mathematical rules of projection
written or transmitted in a (specified) way
the fine and applied arts of representation, decoration, and writing or printing on flat surfaces together with the techniques and crafts associated with them
the art or profession of using design elements (such as typography and images) to convey information or create an effect
a product of this art
an electronic device for adjusting the frequency response of an audio system by means of a number of controls each of which adjusts the response for a band centered on a particular frequency
a story that is presented in comic-strip format and published as a book
